Class ec.ezlib.prim.tests.ERunDemo 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ezlib.prim.tests.ERunDemo
public class ERunDemo
extends Object
Demonstrates (and trivially tests) EZLib's event-loop concurrency style and its Promise-based optimism. Running "java ec.ezlib.prim.tests.ERunDemo" should result in 

 Deferred promise, Unresolved Resolver, Deferred promise
 kept: 4
 hello world, Forwarded Resolver, 4
Which does happen under the Cafe debugger. Strangely, when run from bash we get instead: 
 Deferred promise, Unresolved Resolver, Deferred promise
 hello world, Forwarded Resolver, Deferred promise
So we've got a concurrency bug that doesn't occur under the debugger. Oh joy!

ERunDemo()

main(String[])

ERunDemo 
 public ERunDemo()

main 
 public static void main(String args[]) throws IOException
